beginner.title: Data Type Question 1
beginner.description: Which data type is used to store a single character in Java?
beginner.code:
// Choose the correct data type
char letter = 'A';
beginner.explanation: Option A is correct. 'char' stores a single 16-bit Unicode character.

beginner.title: Boolean Type Question 2
beginner.description: Which keyword is used for a boolean type in Java?
beginner.code:
// Which is correct?
boolean flag = true;
beginner.explanation: Option B is correct. 'boolean' is the keyword for true/false values.

beginner.title: String Declaration Question 3
beginner.description: How do you correctly declare a String variable?
beginner.code:
// Which is correct?
String name = "John";
beginner.explanation: Option C is correct. String literals must use double quotes.

beginner.title: Arithmetic Operator Question 4
beginner.description: What is the output of 5 + 3 in Java?
beginner.code:
// Arithmetic operation
int result = 5 + 3;
beginner.explanation: Option B is correct. 5 + 3 results in integer addition = 8.

beginner.title: Variable Declaration Question 5
beginner.description: What is the correct way to declare an integer variable in Java?
beginner.code:
// Which declaration is correct?
int number = 42;
beginner.explanation: Option A is correct. 'int' is the primitive data type for integers.
